articles.title: Twitter's rebrand to X is causing scam alerts on Microsoft Edge
articles.description: 'Twitters swift rebrand to X is generating yet another issue. As reported by Bleeping Computer, the social media platform is causing Microsoft's Edge browser to throw up a warning, indicating some sort of security problem.It seems to be related to how Edge an…
articles.content: 'Twitters swift rebrand to X is generating yet another issue. As reported by Bleeping Computer, the social media platform is causing Microsoft's Edge browser to throw up a warning, indicating some so… [+1677 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
The sudden name change is part of a larger plan to turn Twitter into a "super app" that's similar to China's popular WeChat.'Twitters swift rebrand to X is generating yet another issue.The platform could theoretically be used for payments, messaging and calls in the future.It is supposed to alert you when a website suddenly changes its favicon as that could indicate a potential redirect to a scam website.X even ran into trouble when attempting to change its signage at its San Francisco headquarters, as it didn't have the required permits.With the Twitter rebrand being so sudden, Edge likely thinks X is a scam.We've reached out to Microsoft for comment and will update this story once we've heard back.The X.com domain's previous owners broke the country's content laws.The company had to abandon its would-be facelift and leave the old bird logo and the letters "er" intact for a day or so.Other companies such as Meta and Microsoft already own trademarks on variations of X, which could land Musk's company some lawsuits.Still, this is yet another indicator of how sudden the Twitter-to-X transition was.Presumably, this is temporary and will be fixed quickly.But as Bleeping Computer points out, PWA is working as intended.The security alert prompts users to review the icon update and reads, "If this web app is trying to trick you into thinking it's a different app, uninstall it."It seems to be related to how Edge and other Chromium-based web browsers deal with favicons (or 'Progressive Web App Icon Change', if you want to get super technical about it).Florian / X
This is similar to an incident  earlier this week, where X was blocked in Indonesia as it has laws forbidding gambling or porn.As reported by Bleeping Computer, the social media platform is causing Microsoft's Edge browser to throw up a warning, indicating some sort of security problem.
articles.summary: the sudden name change is part of a larger plan to turn twitter into a super app thats similar to chinas popular wechat

articles.title: Masahiro Sakurai says he ‘can’t really imagine a Smash Bros. title without me’
articles.description: Masahiro Sakurai, the creator of the Super Smash Bros. series, said in a new YouTube video that he “can’t really imagine a Smash Bros. title without me.”
articles.content:
Masahiro Sakurai says he cant really imagine a Smash Bros. title without me
Masahiro Sakurai says he cant really imagine a Smash Bros. title without me
 / In a new YouTube video, the Smash Bros. cr… [+2184 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
At present, we don’t have someone who can simply take the reins...Smash Bros. is a massive, important title for Nintendo, so it’s fair to assume there will be another one at some point, but it’s going to take some work to figure out exactly how to make that happen.I’m just going to transcribe exactly what he said about that:

The question now is, what happens next time?I feel the same way President [Satoru] Iwata did when we formed the team for Smash Bros. Brawl.RelatedMasahiro Sakurai on the future of Smash: ‘I’ve been doing too much of the work myself’Masahiro Sakurai might already be my favorite YouTuberHayao Miyazaki’s How Do You Live is a beautiful relic — and the end of an eraOr maybe, like the legendary Studio Ghibli director Hayao Miyazaki, Sakurai will just keep on working.Perhaps for the next title, he’ll train up some kind of series successor so he can cruise into retirement.But for now, at least, I can’t really imagine a Smash Bros. title without me.To me, that sounds like Sakurai might still be open to working on the series in the future.I mean whatever comes after Smash Bros.For my part, I’d like to keep working with Nintendo however I’m able.One option would be the separate the series itself from the original creator.Masahiro Sakurai, the creator of the Super Smash Bros. series, is famous for his extremely hands-on role in developing the games.During the video, Sakurai pondered how Nintendo might structure a team for a potential next entry in the Smash Bros. series and his fears that there isn’t one person who can take over from him.Ultimate.That was the first Smash Bros. title where Sakurai as a freelance director instead of as a staffer for HAL Laboratory.But even though he’s said in the past that he’s done “too much of the work myself” on the series, in a new video, he said that he “can’t really imagine a Smash Bros. title without me.”

Sakurai made the statement as part of a video on his YouTube channel about the development of Super Smash Bros. Brawl for the Nintendo Wii.You might think that’s a natural stance for someone in my role, but I say so speaking objectively.

Zuckerberg has seemed pretty serious about the fight from the get-go, and Musk eventually relented, tweeting (x-ing?)And though he generally treated the whole thing as a joke, Musk did sort of prepare for the fight by accepting a training offer from UFC champ Georges St-Pierre and sparring with podcaster Lex Fridman.The cage fight was supposed to be a glitzy Las Vegas affair, with the pair of billionaires dancing around the topics of date and venue for the past month or so.Of course, that's when he's taking a break from retweeting (re-xing?)In an audio recording exclusively provided to the publication, the surprisingly buff Zuckerberg told Meta employees at a company town hall that he’s “not sure if it’s going to come together.”
Zuckerberg’s comments on the match occurred during a company-wide discussion regarding Meta’s recently-launched Twitter rival, Threads, which has been stuttering a bit in the weeks since blasting onto the scene.Musk also said he has this “great move” called "the walrus" where he lays on top of opponents and does nothing.that he was “up for a cage match” if the Meta CEO was.Sad news for fans of billionaires beating the paste out of one another.Zuck didn’t actually say the match is off, just that it remains unlikely.So keep that glass half full, fight fans.Zuck certainly seemed ready to take on the challenge, according to trainer and MMA legend Alex Volkanovski.Dana White, president of the UFC, has also told reporters that the organization was ready to assist with the event.Musk, who loves the letter “X” more than most people love clean air, hasn’t issued a response, but given Zuckerberg’s recent penchant for jiu jitsu, he could be relieved.hateful anti-trans content and changing the site's rules to allow for misgendering.It looks like the Mark Zuckerberg vs Elon Musk cage match isn’t happening, according to exclusive audio heard by Reuters.

articles.paraphrased_content: That’s not greased lighting, but it’s still better than what we’re seeing in this leak.Some online theorize the date could mean Samsung is finishing up its paperwork before formally announcing the model.We don’t really know.There’s no information on how long it would take to charge through a USB-C connection.Putting two and two together, there's a good chance the reveal is coming sooner rather than later.The listing also has what appears to be an image for the S23 FE on someone’s desk.That’s certainly a long time just to charge a smartphone battery, especially in 2023.Newly leaked information for the Samsung Galaxy S23 FE (Fan Edition) indicates the upcoming budget smartphone may charge very slowly – at least wirelessly.A listing for the device recently appeared on the Wireless Power Consortium (WPC), a website created to promote wireless charging and its various standards.We do believe the S23 FE will have better wireless charging capabilities even if the WPC post says otherwise.The quality isn’t great, but it does showcase the front of the phone displaying the bezels around the screen plus the buttons on the right side.According to some theorizing by 9to5Google, it may take “three or more hours” to fully charge the phone using a wireless charger.He never gives a date; although the WPC post has a registration date of July 25.So what gives?Imminent launchIt is worth pointing out Justin Hume, Vice-President of Samsung Mobile in South Africa, recently told Android Authority that “there is an FE-sized gap between the Galaxy A54 5G and Galaxy S23”.Presuming Justin Hume’s statement is true, the world will know for sure soon.Be sure to check out TechRadar’s list of the best cheap smartphones for 2023.Anker, a company specializing in power banks and charges, states the average charge for a phone is around 30 minutes to an hour.There’s no photo of the the rear, unfortunately, so what the rear lenses look like remains a mystery.It shows the GalaxyS23 FE has been given a “maximum received power” rating of 4.4 watts.Recent renders suggest the Galaxy S23 FE will have a camera system similar to the standard Galaxy S23.As always, take this information with a grain of salt.Hume goes on to say there will be “an announcement made” for a new Fan Edition device.The last time the company launched a Fan Edition phone was Galaxy S21 FE, which supports 15W wireless charging.Although to be fair, there is a good chance Samsung will equip the Galaxy S23 FE with tech to boost its charging capabilities.

articles.author: Nathan Birch
articles.title: Final Fantasy XIV Coming to Xbox with Crossplay, Square Enix Commits to Xbox Going Forward
articles.description:
Since launching a decade ago, Final Fantasy XIV has been a PlayStation console exclusive, an arrangement many never expected to change. Well, surprise! Today during the big Final Fantasy XIV […]
Written by Nathan Birch
articles.content: Since launching a decade ago, Final Fantasy XIV has been a PlayStation console exclusive, an arrangement many never expected to change. Well, surprise! Today during the big Final Fantasy XIV Fan Fest… [+2157 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
Today during the big Final Fantasy XIV Fan Festival, Phil Spencer strode out onto the stage with FF14 producer Naoki Yoshida to announce the game is coming to Xbox early next year.Needless to say, this is a fairly big turnabout, as exactly the opposite has been true lately.An open beta will launch alongside the game’s 6.5x update, which will likely arrive early in 2023.Since launching a decade ago, Final Fantasy XIV has been a PlayStation console exclusive, an arrangement many never expected to change.The Xbox Series X/S version of Final Fantasy XIV will offer full crossplay, as well as 4K resolution on the Series X.Together with his team, we are bringing the best online experience for this game to Xbox fans everywhere and through crossplay you can experience Final Fantasy XIV with old and new players alike."We're very happy to announce the Xbox version of Final Fantasy XIV with my friend Yoshida-san here today.According to Yoshi-P, Spencer was heavily involved in bringing Final Fantasy XIV to Xbox, and Spencer himself called this a “seminal moment” in Microsoft’s relationship with Square Enix."We see this as a seminal moment in our relationship with you [referring to Yoshida] and the Final Fantasy team as we look to partner more closely together in the future."Share this story
				 Facebook
 TwitterUltimately though, it was Square Enix’s new CEO Takashi Kiryu who made the strongest statement, saying in no uncertain terms that the company is “planning to bring our games to Xbox” going forward.Here’s what Phil had to say…
"It's great to be here with so many Warriors of Light, thank you for the very warm welcome.Interestingly, it seems this will be part of a deeper partnership between Xbox and Square Enix.Some even believed an acquisition by Sony was in the works, but now it seems like that won’t be the case.Well, surprise!Again, Spencer also slipped in that line about the Xbox version of FF14 offering the “best online experience,” whatever that might mean.The Xbox community is passionate about games, and like so many players around the world, the Final Fantasy series is one that gets lots of love from Team Xbox.Not only have big titles like Final Fantasy XVI been PlayStation exclusive, but even lower profile games were arbitrarily skipping Microsoft’s platform.Final Fantasy XIV arrives on Xbox Series X/S in the spring of 2024.

articles.description: Meta’s long-in-the-works mobile version of Horizon Worlds, its VR metaverse social platform, may finally launch soon, according to Friday’s Lowpass newsletter from Janko Roettgers. Meta is also officially releasing a new game in Horizon Worlds called Super Ru…

Metas Horizon Worlds mobile app might actually be launching soon
Metas Horizon Worlds mobile app might actually be launching soon
 / The social platform has been exclusively available in VR, but a … [+2809 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
Apparently, the company had built a working version last year, but “we ended up not shipping it,” Vishal Shah, Meta’s metaverse VP, said in an interview with Roettgers.A mobile version of Horizon Worlds could help Meta better compete with Fortnite and Roblox, which similarly let creators build social games and experiences.Meta has a new in-Horizon game, Super Rumble

Shah did tell Roettgers that Super Rumble, a shooter game Meta just officially launched inside Horizon Worlds, will be among the first games beta tested for the platform on mobile.Meta’s long-in-the-works mobile version of Horizon Worlds, its VR metaverse social platform, may finally launch soon, according to Friday’s Lowpass newsletter from Janko Roettgers.That’s not even close to an apples-to-apples comparison — Threads is a free app for smartphones, while Horizon Worlds currently requires a Quest VR headset — but it goes to show just how different the scale is between the two platforms right now.In October, CNBC reported that the platform had less than 200,00 users; Meta’s newly-launched Threads, on the other hand, surpassed 100 million users within days.“It was a little bit too much of a VR game on mobile as opposed to a mobile-native experience.”

Shah didn’t tell Roettgers exactly when the app will be available on mobile, though.(Meta’s metaverse work remains a money sink, with the company reporting a net loss of $3.7 billion for its Reality Labs division last quarter.)Interestingly, as Horizon Worlds is looking to mobile, Roblox is looking more at VR; Roblox just launched in open beta on Quest headsets on Thursday.That game apparently looks much nicer than most experiences on the platform due to the fact that it “has been built with imported objects, assets and textures, something that wasn’t previously possible with Horizon,” Roettgers says.And I won’t be confident in an imminent release until Meta actually gives a specific timeline; at the end of January, Meta itself said the app would be coming to mobile and the web “soon,” but it’s still not here yet.The ability to bring over imported assets will apparently be available to hand-picked developers to start and rolled out more widely down the line.Horizon Worlds hasn’t yet been a huge hit for Meta.Meta didn’t immediately reply to a request for comment on timing for the mobile and web apps.We’ve been aware of Meta working on a mobile version of Horizon Worlds, the company’s metaverse social platform that is currently only available on its Quest VR devices, for quite some time, but it’s still not here.
articles.summary: meta’s metaverse work remains a money sink with the company reporting a net loss of 37 billion for its reality labs division last quarter

articles.author: Sean Hollister
articles.title: Today I learned they make delightfully retro cassette tape power banks
articles.description: You can now charge your phone with a cassette tape. Shenzhen accessories manufacturer Remax has apparently been on it for over a year, debuting “10,000mAh” batteries that look like classic cassettes.
articles.content:
Today I learned they make delightfully retro cassette tape power banks
Today I learned they make delightfully retro cassette tape power banks
 / A Shenzhen company called Remax does, specifically.… [+1779 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content: Green vs. Yellow.As a ‘90s kid who dreamed of being an ‘80s adult, this immediately commanded my attention: you can now charge your phone with a cassette tape.Still, super cute stocking stuffer, and should probably be good for one full charge of a single phone at a time.The reason I’m not instantly plopping down my own $25: I suspect I’ll be disappointed by their charge.Shenzhen accessories manufacturer Remax has apparently been on it for over a year, debuting “10,000mAh” batteries that look like classic cassettes.The original yellow and red models also don’t have a good place to put your charging cable — something remedied on the new green version, which adds pull-out flexible 20W Type-C and Lightning cables while ditching a weaksauce LED flashlight and the micro-USB input.Depending on the color — yellow, red, or the new green 2023 model — you can charge them up with USB-C, micro-USB, or even an Apple Lightning cable, then output up to 22.5W over USB-A or USB-C to fast-charge a phone.The $20-$40 batteries aren’t quite as nifty as I originally imagined.While they may nominally contain 10,000mAh batteries, the fine print shows a “rated capacity” of just 5200mAh, and the red model, at least, only promises 300 charge cycles before that capacity wanes.I’ll leave you with a brief YouTube hands-on I spotted with last year’s yellow variant — Paul here was pretty impressed with the overall feel.While they do awesomely come with their own transparent cassette tape cases, they’re definitely larger than a classic cassette, and there’s no spinning parts to fiddle with.

articles.author: michael.allison@futurenet.com (Michael Allison)
articles.title: Samsung has proof that big tablets like the Tab S9 Ultra really do help productivity
articles.description: Samsung’s most expensive Galaxy Tab did well enough to warrant a sequel, the company says.
articles.content:
Samsung’s $1300 Galaxy Tab S9
 Ultra may seem like an overpriced entry into the Android tablet market – but there’s a pretty good reason Samsung released such an expensive device. It sells better th… [+2256 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content: I've used a BlackBerry PlayBook to write school essays.They can run all software ever, whether directly as on Windows, or through systems like Parallels if you’re using one of the best MacBooks or best Chromebooks.Excellent as the Surface Pro 9 and the (short-lived) Surface Pro X were, I’m now a big believer in the right tool for the job.When it comes to productivity, laptops have an inherent advantage.Samsung did a great job of building an iPad Pro rival.In my experience, tablets can be productive in a pinch.I’m not opposed to the concept.The optimized One UI software, powerful hardware, and elegant keyboard accessory all came together to build a competent laptop replacement.It sells better than you’d expect.According to Samsung in an interview with TechRadar, the Galaxy Tab S8 Ultra accounted for 30% of the Tab S8 series, with most users opting to use it for productivity over consumption, at least in comparison to the Tab S8 and Tab S8 Plus.Samsung’s Junho Park, VP (Director of Global Product Planning), told Techradar, “Customers are using the S8 Ultra for both productivity and entertainment, but the proportion of customers using the tablet for productivity is higher than the equivalent figure for the rest of the Tab S8 series.”In other words, while the Galaxy Tab S8 Ultra accounted for a third of total Tab S8 sales (Despite its price difference), users who selected it were intentional with their choice.More than a Tab S9 Ultra can ever dream of, a real computer like the MacBook Pro or the Surface Laptop is a versatile workhorse.Samsung’s $1300 Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra may seem like an overpriced entry into the Android tablet market – but there’s a pretty good reason Samsung released such an expensive device.There’s just one problem: laptops still exist.Can a tablet really be productive?With the Galaxy Tab S8 Ultra and the Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra, Samsung certainly hopes you think the answer is yes.Whether it’s true or not will depend on you.And if you check out our Galaxy Tab S8 Ultra review, it’s pretty obvious why.I have a OnePlus Pad with a keyboard and full access to Android apps.They are built for working first and foremost.Samsung says that people were more likely to be productive on the Tab S9 Ultra than other devices.They come with keyboards and trackpads.They have access to peripherals and all sorts of extensible ports.I was a big advocate of being productive on a tablet with Microsoft’s Surface Pro.

articles.title: X officially rolls out its ads revenue sharing program for creators
articles.description: Twitter, which Elon Musk is currently rebranding to X, is officially rolling out its ads revenue sharing program for creators. Users globally can apply to participate in the program, though you’ll need to subscribe to X Blue or be a Verified Organization.
articles.content:
X officially rolls out its ads revenue sharing program for creators

articles.paraphrased_content: The program has been in the works for some time.Musk first announced it in February, saying that the revenue share kicked off “starting today.” It took a few months the initial payouts finally started rolling in, with some saying they earned thousands of dollars.You’ll get payouts as long as X determines that you’ve generated more than $50.“We want the process to be as simple as possible, so all eligible X Blue and Verified Organizations subscribers are entitled to revenue share so long as they meet the eligibility criteria and join,” the company says.Twitter, which Elon Musk is currently rebranding to X, is officially rolling out its ads revenue sharing program for creators.The company had given some creators payouts earlier this month, but now, users globally who meet the eligibility criteria can apply for the program from the monetization tab in settings.To be eligible for the program, you need to be subscribed to X Blue (which appears to be the new name for Twitter Blue) or be a Verified Organization, have “at least 15M impressions on your cumulative posts within the last 3 months,” and have at least 500 followers, according to a support document about the program.The support document about the program doesn’t specify how the company determines the value of its payouts.

articles.title: Only one laptop will get AMD's best mobile gaming processor ever, and that's a huge shame
articles.description: AMD is equipping only a single laptop with its best mobile gaming processor yet, the Ryzen 9 7945HX3D.
articles.content:
It seems that the rumor mill was right about AMD’s latest mobile gaming processor, as the tech giant officially announced the AMD Ryzen 9 7945HX3D. But there’s a catch.
The only caveat is that this … [+2015 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content: So it feels like Team Red is squandering a real chance to push Team Blue’s hold on the processor market.And this isn’t the only time AMD has done this either.And back in 2022, the tech giant launched the AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D but it was produced in low volume and was the only 5000-series chip to sport the extra cache until 2023.And that's a shame as this is probably the best mobile chip ever, and the first one to use the excellent 3D V-Cache technology.It’s similar to the Ryzen 9 7945HX except that, according to PC Gamer, it has the full 64MB of L3 cache bonded on top of one of its eight-core chiplets.It seems that the rumor mill was right about AMD’s latest mobile gaming processor, as the tech giant officially announced the AMD Ryzen 9 7945HX3D.But there’s a catch.The only caveat is that this processor will be available for a single laptop, the Asus ROG Strix Scar 17 X3D.It really seems that AMD’s Dragon Range series could be one of the best AMD processors and even one of the best processors in general.Previously it released the AMD Ryzen 5 5600X3D processor in limited supply only at Micro Center, which was a baffling decision to say the least.It also has the same TDP and the same peak 5.4GHz clock speed, if the chiplet doesn’t have the extra L3 of course.According to AMD, the Ryzen 9 7945HX3D’s full specs are as follows: Zen 4 architecture, 16 cores and 32 threads, L2 cache of 16GB and L3 cache of 128GB, TDP between 55 and 75W, and an AMD Radeon 610M GPU.The AMD Ryzen 9 7945HX3D processor will be launching on August 22nd, 2023, which is just after Gamescom.AMD is wasting a great opportunity Considering how incredible the 3D V-Cache technology is, as it manages to get extra performance out of a chip without having to bump up the amount of energy or cooling that chip would normally need, it’s a shame that only one laptop will get to benefit from it.Especially since this tech is ideal for portable machines, as it allows some of the best gaming laptops to get great performance without having to risk additional ventilation issues.And this chip is even more valuable to AMD because it could give both the Intel Raptor Lake-HX and the upcoming 14th-gen CPU refresh a run for the money.

articles.content: NVIDIA has benefited tremendously from the AI hype, generating revenue figures not yet seen in the industry. A report claims that NVIDIA's cut-down AI GPUs in China are now sold at astonishing prices… [+1832 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
News Source: MyDrivers
				
				Share this story
				 Facebook
 TwitterAnother fact highlighted by the report is that NVIDIA is also pricing its products based on "relationships" with its clients.The source report that the A800 and H800 GPUs are now being sold for an all-time high, reaching almost 500,000 yuan.It was previously reported that ByteDance purchased $1 billion worth of NVIDIA AI GPUs for server applications.This ecosystem has evolved mainly because of one reason; NVIDIA has created a monopoly over the industry, and there are no competitors.NVIDIA Seems to Be Creating a Monopoly Over the AI Industry, GPU Demand & Prices Increasing Day-by-Day
The rapid increase in the demand for AI GPUs, such as the H800, has caused a shortage in Chinese markets, which has resulted in large-scale inflation.The "extent" of the connection with the company will determine what price companies will get.Considering that the GPUs sold in China are much inferior in performance, it is surprising that they have gained massive traction in Chinese markets.Hence, companies that require AI GPUs are bound to reach out to NVIDIA, which gives Team Green an upper hand.At first, acquiring huge orders will require a good relationship with the company's CEO Jensen Huang.The figure is a large one to ask, and we won't be surprised if NVIDIA continues to sell the GPUs at this price since AI isn't a thing to mess around with in China.However, this monopoly "bubble" could burst out anytime since the industry is continuously evolving, and new competitors will hopefully emerge, a prime example being Intel introducing their "Gaudi2 AI Accelerators" in China.The need for AI GPUs has been at an all-time high in China since companies like Alibaba and ByteDance are acquiring high volumes of such GPUs.NVIDIA has benefited tremendously from the AI hype, generating revenue figures not yet seen in the industry.Related StoryHassan MujtabaNVIDIA’s Explosive AI Growth Leads To Increased GPU Prices, Limited Supply & Massive Order BacklogAs a reminder, NVIDIA is selling cut-down variants of the H100 and A100 GPUs in China to bypass US sanctions.A report claims that NVIDIA's cut-down AI GPUs in China are now sold at astonishing prices, reaching as high as 500,000 yuan/ US $69,000.

. 
While the Shutterstock service has long been hailed as one of the best free stock photo sites
 on the web, there’s more… [+8514 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content: Click on its icon, and three new images will be generated from the one you selected, each slightly further away from the last, revealing more of the scene -although, for us, the last one seemed to always be more of a flight of fancy than the other two.Those AI images are created based on the assets already in Shutterstock’s library, and your mileage will definitely vary.If you’re familiar with the concept of text-to-image AI art generators, it’s pretty much the same here: type in a description of what you’d like to see, add as many keywords as you can think of, and click on ‘Generate’.You can, of course, start a design from scratch, but templates are one of the biggest draws here.Still, maybe that’s why Predict is still in beta.‘Catalog’ offers a quick link to your collections, assets and designs, making it easy to manage them all from the same place.There was something we kept quiet about in our recent Shutterstock review.Although it’s important to note that when you subscribe to one of Shutterstock’s monthly or annual plans, you’ll get Creative Flow+ included for free.If you don’t need access to those plans, Creative Flow+ will cost you $13 per month, or $120 per year, and if you’re curious about the service, there’s a free month’s trial on offer as well, removing any reason you might have to not try it out.However when it works, it works very well, and you’re given some simple tools to refine the results.You also have a selection of ‘Pro Effects’ at your disposal - they’re fun to use but they have no obvious editable options.By default you have no ‘Style’ set, giving the AI free reign over what to produce, but you can narrow down the outcome to Photo, Art, Digital, 3D or Scene if you like, and also choose from one of the displayed keywords.The most interesting option which caught our eye was ‘Zoom out’, available on every thumbnail.Think of it as a simplified version of Photoshop - a Photoshop alternative that uses templates to get you started fast.There are also a series of online companion apps, available under the banner Creative Flow+.Which leads us to the last two which we’ll look at in greater detail below: ‘Generate’ and ‘Create’.Getting started: 3/5 Creative Flow+: GenerateGenerate isn’t technically part of Creative Flow+ since you have to pay for the results you wish to use, but it’s an AI creation tool which can be added to your workflow  (Image credit: Shutterstock)AI comes to Shutterstock, with varying degrees of success, but its output isn’t part of your Creative Flow+ subscription AI is everywhere - and that includes Creative Flow+.Creative Flow+: Pricing & plansA service that’s included in Shutterstock subscriptions, available as a standalone product with a free trial Creative Flow+ is a standalone subscription, independent of the rest of Shutterstock’s offerings.But to be honest, aside from setting the right aspect ratio for your project, it’s hard to discern what the templates on offer have that the templates available in Create don’t.For starters, although it’s perfectly possible, you don’t need to upload your own media to Create, but have thousands of photos to choose from - whose use is included with your subscription.Doing a search will also display results from Shutterstock’s library however, and there’s sadly no way to discern which images belong to it, and which are part of your subscription - until you add one to your project and see watermarks all over it.If you like them, you’ll have to pay for them via a separate Shutterstock subscription or through the purchase of on-demand packs.Generate: 3/5Creative Flow+: CreateCreative Flow+ has many editing tools at your disposal, including a powerful background remover, filters, effects, and more (Image credit: Shutterstock)An impressive array of tools to design content in your browser, although there are some limitations ‘Create’ is the real star of the show.Now of course, the more uncluttered the background, the easier it will be for Create to excise the foreground from it, and we did encounter some whose composition was too complex for Create to handle.It would be more user-friendly if some overlay could be displayed on the thumbnail to tell us at a glance which are free and which aren’t.Creative Flow+’s text tools are quite broad and extensive (Image credit: Shutterstock)Add an image to your canvas, and perhaps one of the most useful and impressive tools is ‘Remove Background’.It’s also effortless to duplicate your project (via Catalog) so you can work on a different version, or set up personal templates in that way, to speed up any future projects you might wish to produce.Create: 4.5/5 Creative Flow+: ScorecardSwipe to scroll horizontallyRow 0 - Cell 0 Row 0 - Cell 1 Row 0 - Cell 2 Pricing & plansPart of the Shutterstock subscription, but available alone5Getting startedPlenty of apps to use, but can be difficult to parse3GenerateGood AI art generator, but not part of the subscription3CreateExcellent online design app with some limitations4.5Should I try?Being web-based, Creative Flow+’s tools have their limits, but you can still do an impressive amount with them (Image credit: Shutterstock)Try it if...You need access to royalty free images to design projects quickly online, organize yourself, plan with other members of your team, and get AI help to predict the next trend.However, we think it’s a bit of a stretch to include it in the Creative Flow+ sidebar, as the results generated aren’t actually part of your subscription.Put simply, it’s a combination of web-based apps and graphic design software designed to help you organize yourself, and produce visual content to promote and market your business.As such, it comes with five separate apps, all accessible from the interface’s sidebar on the left.While the Shutterstock service has long been hailed as one of the best free stock photo sites on the web, there’s more to the creative platform than assets and content library.Pricing & plans: 5/5Creative Flow+: Getting startedYou works with layers in Creative Flow+, enabling you to design complex, yet easy to manipulate, projects (Image credit: Shutterstock)A series of apps, from scheduling to creating, all accessed from the sidebar on the left So what is Creative Flow+?In order to facilitate the process you can provide it with images from Shutterstock’s library, upload some from your own collection, or just skip that step to see what Predict can… well… predict for you.The real fun begins in Create’s editing section.You’ll find a wealth of tools to work with.Don't try it if...You’re not enamored with getting yet another subscription service, and would need the sort of powerful tools found in the best photo editors and dedicated software.The focus is certainly on social media, but Create also has ready-made canvases for print, such as Flyers, Invitations or Brochures for instance.But choosing the right template or canvas size is but the start.You can try Shutterstock Creative Flow+ by clicking here.It’s even possible to link to collections you’ve already created to make sure all assets for a project stay together.‘Predict’ is an AI-based tool to speed up the creation process of posts aimed at Facebook, Instagram or Pinterest.Click ‘Generate’ again, or alter your description.‘Plan’, for instance, is a calendar, made to keep you and your team organized.And everything is layer-based, meaning you can reorder objects with ease, lock them into place, or even delete them altogether.Of course, Create can’t hope to compete with dedicated software, but the wealth of features found in those programs can be overwhelming, especially if you’re new to content creation (or you just need to build a lot of assets fast).Yet here you have in your hands a lot of options that can help you create relatively complex designs in very little time, ready to download and use to promote your work or product.There are so many to choose from, all organized by category, such as Facebook Covers, YouTube Thumbnails, and Instagram Stories.You can color correct your image of course, crop it, erase sections, or even animate their appearance onto your canvas, should you be working on a project that supports such action.There’s a wealth of graphics you can add and customize, a selection of brushes for freehand drawing, and a vast choice of fonts you can add to your project.After a few seconds you’ll be presented with four images.Don’t like what you see?

articles.author: Jessica Conditt
articles.title: Indie games have entered the era of bespoke publishing
articles.description: For anyone with an eye on video game news, it’s been hard to ignore the recent rise of names like Annapurna Interactive, Devolver Digital, Private Division, Humble, Epic Games and Netflix tied to independent projects. The distribution process for indie develo…
articles.content: For anyone with an eye on video game news, its been hard to ignore the recent rise of names like Annapurna Interactive, Devolver Digital, Private Division, Humble, Epic Games and Netflix tied to inde… [+9808 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
In this marketplace, it’s hard to stand out without a little help.The streaming company officially entered the game-distribution business in 2021, and it’s on track to have 100 titles in its library by the end of 2023, all freely available to anyone with a Netflix subscription.With Netflix’s resources, the Night School team was able to add day-one support for 32 languages in Oxenfree II, and they were able to fly in remote collaborators as needed.It’s this fantasy world with no currency, even, and all that’s intentional.For the moment, this shift is powering a small but highly visible boom in the world of indie games.And then there’s Netflix.“And now in the last few years, literally, it's non-stop.”
The acquisition allowed Night School to move into the Netflix offices and it provided stability for the studio overall, Krankel said.So much money that outside companies are popping up and trying to get a piece of the pie — and for now, it’s created a shiny bubble of pretty PR packages and bespoke showcases dedicated to small teams and their games.Ruiz did contract work for a while after Aztez, and in 2018 he pitched Bounty Star to people he knew at Annapurna.As the creative director, I didn't want any of that stuff.“All that's really exciting,” Oxenfree II lead developer Bryant Cannon said just ahead of the game’s July 12th release.This system has already distributed innovative and important games to huge audiences — Tchia, Tunic, Sea of Solitude, Gris — and it’s offered stability to a lot of independent artists.There were 309 games added to Steam in 2010; in 2017, there were 6,306.He began working on Aztez in 2010, when Steam was a curated marketplace where Valve employees hand-selected individual games for the platform.“You'll notice real quick that the game that you've been playing can't be free-to-play,” Medeiros told Engadget in April.There’s also Humble, Private Division, Raw Fury, Epic Games, Finji, Gearbox, EA and Netflix, all of which have stepped up their indie publishing efforts in recent years.You don't have to do that stuff.Devolver Digital is the granddaddy of indie publishers, and since 2009 it’s released hits including Hotline Miami, Hatoful Boyfriend, The Talos Principle, Gris, Fall Guys, Inscryption, Weird West and Cult of the Lamb, all in collaboration with small development teams.Like, for instance, Ben Ruiz.Like, they're not averse to scale.”
It’s not just Annapurna making these types of deals with indies nowadays.Its showcases are now a staple of the gaming calendar.For now, it’s a functional system, even if it ultimately leaves publishers, rather than independent developers, with most of the power.Simogo’s latest projects, Sayonara Wild Hearts and Lorelei and the Laser Eyes, are the result of its partnership with Annapurna.The distribution process for indie developers has shifted over the past few years from a self-publishing-first model, to one that prioritizes deal-making and acquisitions.He founded two studios, he did contract work on titles including Super Meat Boy and Overland, and he independently published a tentpole original project, the monochromatic brawler Aztez.Sayonara Wild HeartsAnnapurna Interactive
“I think for us as a studio, the biggest change is working with a publisher, something which we would see as completely uninteresting and impractical ten years ago,” Simogo co-founder Simor Flesser told Engadget earlier this month.The first of these purchases was Night School, which Netflix acquired in 2021.Amid the ongoing writers’ and actors’ strike, the company is facing accusations that it instituted wildly unfair compensation deals for creatives, paying out one-time, minimal wages even as projects became massive hits on the streaming service.Bounty Star is being published by Annapurna Interactive and it’s due out in early 2024.The game has a complex premise — it stars Clem, a desert bounty hunter with plenty of baggage, and it involves mech battles, emotional narrative scenes and home-management mechanics, including some light gardening.Meanwhile, Microsoft’s strategy is to simply acquire the studios it likes, and today it has 23 developers under the Xbox Game Studios banner.Because I mean, I liked games before all that stuff happened.Annapurna bit, and Ruiz landed a publishing deal.“Like, where would the ads go?Sony is taking a similar approach, though it owns fewer studios than Microsoft.It was founded in 2016 as an offshoot of Annapurna Pictures and quickly established its brand as an arthouse publisher, focused on visually innovative and emotionally driven experiences.“It doesn’t feel like they’re just trying to grab a thing that will make money or collaborate with people that are just going to make them money.There are more than 90,000 games on Steam today; Xbox Game Pass and PS Plus Premium libraries each have more than 400 titles (and counting).Nowadays, Ruiz is running a five-person studio called Dinogod and he’s building Bounty Star, a game that blends mech combat with life-sim mechanics.“Consolidation — I didn't really have my finger as much on the pulse of that, because when we joined Netflix, it didn't feel like that was happening so rapidly,” Night School co-founder Sean Krankel told Engadget.There are two big benefits of working with Netflix, according to Snowman creative director Jason Medeiros: The instant access to an audience of more than 230 million people, and the freedom to build a game without worrying about monetization.For now, bespoke publishing is the name of the indie game.“When everything was greenlit, that was the first step, to bring in these five or six people….“The fact that Dinogod has five full time people, that was a part of the partnership,” Ruiz said.Even established studios, such as Device 6 creator Simogo, have swapped to a publisher-first model.Ruiz and his business partner built Aztez in between contract projects, and by the time it was ready to debut on Steam in 2017, the indie market was saturated.“It’s possible, but without help, I just don't know how anyone's doing it … I got a lot of friends in the same boat.”
Ruiz’s career is a microcosm of the shifting landscape for indie developers over the past 10 years.GrisDevolver Digital
It’s difficult to ignore the potential for exploitation down the line, especially with Netflix in the mix.Annapurna is handling the marketing for Bounty Star, and it’s also financially supporting Ruiz’s studio, Dinogod.It's a breath of fresh air; we jump on opportunities to make games that way.”
Of course, there are still developers self-publishing their projects — Vampire Survivors, Phasmophobia, Celeste and Among Us are all standout examples — but there’s a murkier path to success with this model, one based on timing, trends and a hefty amount of luck.Microsoft and Sony are also signing hundreds of one-off deals with indies as they attempt to fill their streaming libraries — Xbox Game Pass and PlayStation Plus Premium — with a steady stream of new experiences.It’s taken 10 years to get here, but it’s now a solid, quantifiable fact: There’s a lot of money in indie games.It shifted to a community-voting approach called Greenlight, before eventually landing on the everything-goes Early Access model we know today.This system had fully imploded by 2012: On the heels of breakout hits like Braid, Super Meat Boy and Fez, the indie market was overrun by new games and developers, and Steam dropped its curation efforts.For anyone with an eye on video game news, it’s been hard to ignore the recent rise of names like Annapurna Interactive, Devolver Digital, Private Division, Humble, Epic Games and Netflix tied to independent projects.Annapurna, for its part, was accused of mishandling claims of abuse at three prominent studios on its publishing roster — Mountains, Funomena and Fullbright — in a March 2022 documentary by People Make Games.Bounty StarAnnapurna Interactive
“Everything favors a publisher relationship, seemingly, because self-publishing has become this extraordinarily difficult thing,” Ruiz said.“I hope Annapurna’s success means more Annapurnas in the future,” Ruiz said.Meanwhile, the current consolidation craze is shrinking the video game industry overall, even as the market caps of the biggest companies continue to rise.This is the new standard for indie developers: Identify the publisher that best matches your game’s tone, pitch it, and pray.It’s already brought a number of high-profile titles to mobile devices, including Kentucky Route Zero, Poinpy, Into the Breach, Spiritfarer, Lucky Luna and Oxenfree II, and it’s purchased a few studios outright — notably, Alphabear developer Spry Fox and Oxenfree house Night School Studio.“I don't think I ever want to self-publish again.”
Ben Ruiz has been a game developer since 2005, and in that time, he’s pretty much done it all.If [Annapurna is] into a thing that they think is a good move, and it needs more people, that seems to be fully okay.They clearly have a brand and an aesthetic directive … if I can keep making games for them for a long time, I will.”
The new normal works for Ruiz — and Flesser, Krankel, Medeiros and plenty of others.So having a platform like Netflix, it's just like, none of that matters.Even with a hefty amount of hype behind it, Aztez had trouble standing out, and that was the last time Ruiz tried self-publishing.Snowman is best known as the name behind Alto’s Adventure and Alto’s Odyssey, and its latest project is Laya’s Horizon, a serene wingsuit experience exclusive to Netflix.When Ruiz pitched the game, he was clear that he’d need a team of five or six people to bring his vision to life, and Annapurna gave him the funding to hire up.StrayAnnapurna Interactive
Annapurna Interactive is one of the most prominent publishers of indie games today, with titles like Stray, Outer Wilds, Neon White, Donut County and What Remains of Edith Finch on its books.“I think the game is going to be better because we have this battery in our back.”
Oxenfree IINetflix
Outside of acquisitions, Netflix is also signing individual deals with developers.

articles.author: Chris Welch
articles.title: Wireless earbuds can actually help you hear conversations better
articles.description: Earbuds like the Apple AirPods Pro and Samsung Galaxy Buds 2 Pro can help you hear speech and conversations more clearly. There’s also a wave of new OTC hearing aids to pick from.
articles.content:
Wireless earbuds can actually help you hear conversations better
Wireless earbuds can actually help you hear conversations better
 / A reader reached out for some advice. Several of todays best ear… [+4986 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
Additionally, Ambient Sound can tune to users’ ears through the Adapt Ambient Sound feature, allowing for even more clarity in helping users hear the world around them better.You can choose between five different levels of amplification and set individual preferences for each ear.Image: Sennheiser

Sennheiser also has a $900 product called the Conversation Clear Plus.And if that’s not enough, there’s a separate “conversation boost” mode that’s designed to make it easier to hear face-to-face conversations happening in front of you.So I can at least toss out some ideas based on the products that I do have thorough knowledge of.And when it happens gradually, you might not even notice until you’re suddenly overwhelmed by the noise.You’ll then see a slider that you can drag to adjust how much environmental noise is piped in whenever transparency mode is active.I’m no doctor, nor am I any kind of hearing health expert.To customize transparency mode:

Tap Transparency Mode, then enable Custom Transparency Mode, and do the same for Ambient Noise Reduction.It’s undoubtedly a goal of these companies to make their consumer products genuinely useful for everyday hearing protection on top of music consumption and at a much lower price.Samsung Galaxy Buds 2 Pro: enhanced ambient sound mode

Samsung also provides granular control over the ambient sound mode on the company’s Galaxy Buds 2 Pro.Moreover, there’s also a slider that can adjust ambient sound from “soft” to “clear” based on what sounds best to each person:

Users can adjust the volumes on the left and the right respectively, as well as customize their Ambient Sound tone range from soft to clear across five different stages.Reticent to call them hearing aids, the company instead refers to these as “a true wireless hearing solution.” As you can see in the image above, the companion app provides extensive controls over how much external sound you want to experience at any given time.Earlier this week, a reader contacted me with a dilemma: his wife has always had super sharp hearing when it comes to environmental / ambient noise.Like the other devices I mentioned, Sennheiser’s hearing buds use “advanced technologies — including active noise cancellation and beamforming — to precisely separate language from noise.”

Again, these hearing-focused gadgets come at a premium.For example, you can now walk into a Best Buy and purchase Sony’s $1,300 ITE self-fitting hearing aids.On this support page, Apple explains both features.She can “hear a gnat blink at 1,000 yards.Photo by Chris Welch / The Verge

The company has funded (non-peer-reviewed) studies that showed the Buds 2 Pro “significantly improved speech perception in those with mild-to-moderate hearing loss.”

Over-the-counter hearing gadgets

A rule from the FDA last year ushered in a new era of over-the-counter hearing aids that can be purchased without a prescription or even an exam.Consulting an audiologist would be my top recommendation for next steps — regardless of anyone’s age.To use conversation boost:

From the same Transparency Mode menu, enable conversation boost.Sony’s hearing aids have a “situation analyzer within the hearing aid” that “adjusts sound based on your surroundings to improve listening experiences in environments with background noise.”

Earbud manufacturers are increasingly focusing on hearing tech.Jabra has also joined in with its own OTC solution.Forty years ago, she could hear electronic clocks running,” he said.These options are far more expensive than mainstream consumer earbuds, but they’re also more directly targeted at the issue.And so they’ve been in search of a solution that would help eliminate some of that background clamor while still helping her clearly hear conversations happening directly in front of her.To save you a click, if you want to test out ambient noise reduction and conversation boost, here’s what to do:

Make sure your AirPods Pro are in your ears and connected to your iPhone.Go to Settings, then Accessibility, then Audio/Visual.Turn on Headphone Accommodations.Samsung’s Galaxy Buds 2 Pro also provide extensive customization of the ambient sound mode.But increasingly, consumer earbuds are trying to plug away at these common issues: everyday life can get loud.But did you know you can customize the level of ambient noise that transparency mode lets through?Apple AirPods Pro: conversation boost

Apple’s wireless earbuds are routinely praised for their natural-sounding transparency mode, and for good reason.It might be worth first exploring the software solutions from Apple and Samsung before spending three times as much on an OTC hearing aid.

Perhaps the most startling revelation was the report that studios offered a “groundbreaking AI proposal” to pay performers for one day of work to use their digital likeness for eternity.HBO’s Succession leads this year’s field with 27 nominations, while The Last of Us made history with an impressive 24 nods for the video game adaptation.Ted Lasso is up for Best Comedy Series among its 21 nominations, which also include Best Actor in a Comedy Series for lead Jason Sudeikis, Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy for Hannah Waddingham and Best Supporting Actor in a Comedy for Phil Dunster.Apple’s mesmerizing sci-fi adaptation Silo debuted too late for consideration this year, but don’t be shocked if it features prominently in the 2024 list.Artificial intelligence figures prominently in both cases: Scribes and performers fear producers will increasingly use AI-generated content to diminish humans’ ability to make a living in the already-brutal show business industry.Elsewhere, Amazon’s colossally ambitious The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power received six nods (mostly in technical categories).Apple
Apple TV+ also fared well in nominations, with 52.HBO led all platforms with 127 nods, while Netflix led streaming-only networks with 103, followed by Apple (52) and Amazon (46).The Primetime Emmys won’t take place on September 18th, according to Variety.The TV Academy hasn’t yet announced a replacement date, but Variety previously reported that broadcast partner Fox tentatively wants to shoot for January 2024.Netflix’s Stranger Things picked up six, Peacock’s Poker Face nabbed four and Star Trek: Picard got two makeup nominations.In addition to The Last of Us and Andor, Outstanding Drama Series nominees include Better Call Saul, House of the Dragon, Succession, The White Lotus and Yellowjackets.Obi-Wan Kenobi, also on Disney+, received five more nominations, including Best Limited or Anthology Series.Hollywood writers began striking in early May, while actors joined them earlier this month.Disney / Lucasfilm
Although The Last of Us marked a milestone for gaming adaptations (including acting nominations for Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey), season three of Disney’s The Mandalorian received an impressive nine nominations.The publication reported on Thursday that vendors scheduled to work the event have been told the ceremony is delayed because of the writers’ and actors’ strikes that have shut down all Hollywood productions and promotions.As generative AI advances quicker than most people could have imagined, it now threatens to annihilate content creators’ careers inside and outside of Hollywood.It recounts the journey of spy Cassian Andor (Diego Luna), one of the fallen heroes of 2016’s Rogue One, in the period building up to the Rebel Alliance’s rise against the Galactic Empire.At the same time, Andor picked up eight nods — including Outstanding Drama Series.

When you post a picture of your cat rolling over, you’re sharing a moment in your life (and your cat’s life) that does not exist anywhere else in the world.Your arms will be so grateful.We cannot see anything.That means you don’t have to stand on your toes to see over the iPad Pro the six-foot-five guy in front of you has been brandishing for two hours.You waited in line for two hours.At any given time, orders of magnitude fewer people will be filming.You can make these whatever you want.Everyone at the show will have a better time — and the footage the rest of us have to watch will look much better, too.Your videos are terribly lit.Here’s today’s second unfortunate truth: our concert footage does not have that impact on anyone else.When you attend a concert, you are limited to three Instagram Stories.We cannot hear her, and it’s high time somebody let you know.No.We aren’t told if a story is going to be concert footage before we click on it.Look, I understand where you’re coming from.I understand the temptation.(In fact, they are probably worse.And you really love Taylor, some of the weirder tracks on Evermore aside, and you want to share her with the world.You paid good money to be here at the Eras Tour or whatever.What better way to achieve these ends than to film the entire concert and post it to your Instagram story?And I think we can reach a compromise.It’s terrible concert footage all the way down.We cannot hear Taylor.Flo Rida does not need to be on your Instagram story.Sorry.)You’re here, you persevered, and you want the world to know it

Also, you’re spending your Saturday night singing “Love Story” at the top of your lungs in a crowd of thousands of very attractive and well-dressed people, and those loser couch potatoes who follow you on Instagram presumably are not.That means fewer phones in your way.But Monica, if you don’t like concert Instagram Stories, just don’t watch them!They take me back to a once-in-a-lifetime memory, an adrenaline and an environment I may never get to experience again.I don’t care, but you get three.Keep a few valuable, choice videos on your phone.A time when I was in the same room as an artist I love, hearing them sing songs I love directly to me.That’s not how Instagram Stories work.You’re here, you persevered, and you want the world to know it.I promise.You fought a relentless battle against Ticketmaster, and dagnabbit, you won.The artist you are filming looks like a teensy, blurry toy army guy that we would not recognize if you hadn’t tagged them 50 times.If you’re someone whose Stories I watch often, your story is usually going to be on my front page when I open Instagram and thus one of the first things I habitually click on, and if you’ve posted 937 Blackpink clips to your story, that means you’re subjecting me to videos of frenzied American crowds attempting to scream the Korean lyrics of “Shut Down” every time I absentmindedly open the app for the next 24 hours.I’m not going to be one of those people who stands here and insists that you will never watch the videos you take.You will show the world that you are at a concert and that you are very cool, social, and musical.I was watching a video I took of BTS’s Los Angeles concert just this morning while waiting for the bus.Don’t post all three hours to Instagram.This will send the message you’re trying to send.There will be three, and we will happily watch three.Here’s what I propose.Photo by Cindy Ord / Getty Images

Finally, I am going to get a bit philosophical.You sat in ridiculous traffic.And that is, frankly, not something any of us needs.You, meanwhile, are recording someone 10,000 miles away from you from the middle of a crowd that is screaming their faces off.I, personally, treasure the small amount of concert footage that I keep on my phone.You can really enjoy watching the concert that you paid good money for, as opposed to spending the whole time fussing over white balance.Trust me.RelatedThe concert of the future is already happening in the metaverseApple adds new concert-finding features to Maps and Music

I don’t care how great your phone’s camera is.You can tag your mom.Even concerts recorded by professionals with high-quality equipment often don’t sound all that great.We just tap your little picture, expecting pictures of your cat, child, dinner, or whatever it is that’s your normal fare because you are someone whose life we are curious about and whose joys we hope to share and celebrate — and then we are bombarded with a stadium full of AirPods-shattering shrieks.You promised your mom that you’d get out of the house more, and you’d like her to know you’re keeping your word.I understand that your concert footage has a lot of meaning to you.The urge is human and valid.It’s concert footage all the way down

But again, I understand.RelatedTaylor Swift versus Ticketmaster: the latest on the tour that may break up a giant

Now, I can already hear the comments.I don’t care what fancy things you think you’ve done with the settings.We will celebrate and heart-react three.Not only that, but a future where everyone follows this rule will make concerts better for everyone.However, I am here to bring you an unfortunate but very necessary truth: nobody wants to watch your concert footage.When you post an objectively terrible video of Harry Styles singing “Fine Line” at Madison Square Garden, you’re posting a video I can find literally anywhere, at any time, on any social platform — and that I’ve probably also already seen on my feed by virtue of being a person that exists on the internet.You can tag the artist.But we don’t need to watch a thousand, and I promise that we will not celebrate or heart-react a thousand times.You were up all night selecting your outfit.Nobody.You are too far back from the stage.Once you’ve filmed your three, you can put your phone down.He’s good.I watch them because they’re a reminder of a time in my life.That’s before we even get into the audio quality.You can tag Tim Cook.I’m sorry, it’s the truth.I myself have done this now and again.But I do not watch my concert videos because they are objectively good, entertaining, or interesting.The room you are in is very, very dark.There are all kinds of ancillary benefits here.They take me back to the roar of the crowd, the heat of the fireworks, the plastic smell of the stadium seats.Now, imagine the experience when Lady Gaga is in town and everyone I follow is there.For someone who wasn’t there with us, our videos are identical to literally any video of this same concert that exists on YouTube or TikTok.

Researchers had to individually program directions.Depending on the type of person you are, this news is either welcome or reminds you of the scary robot dogs from Black Mirror (influenced by Boston Dynamics robots).The robot is a Swiftie, and that is good news for humanity.The new model trained on web and robotics data, leveraging research advances in large language models like Google’s own Bard and combining it with robotic data (like which joints to move), the company said in a paper.Either way, we should expect an even smarter robot next year.The model teaches robots to better recognize visual and language patterns to interpret instructions and infer what objects work best for the request.RelatedGoogle adds AI language skills to Alphabet’s helper robots to better understand humansTesla Bot can walk very slowly and pick up stuff now Alphabet is putting its prototype robots to work cleaning up around Google’s offices

For years, researchers have tried to imbue robots with better inference to troubleshoot how to exist in a real-life environment.Researchers tested RT-2 with a robotic arm in a kitchen office setting, asking its robotic arm to decide what makes a good improvised hammer (it was a rock) and to choose a drink to give an exhausted person (a Red Bull).They also told the robot to move a Coke can to a picture of Taylor Swift.RT-2 is the new version of what the company calls its vision-language-action (VLA) model.It might even clean up a spill with minimal instructions.For example, cleaning up a spilled drink.Google wants to make its robots smarter with the release of the AI learning model Robotic Transformer (RT-2).It also understands directions in languages other than English.Google’s first foray into smarter robots started last year when it announced it would use its LLM PaLM in robotics, creating the awkwardly named PaLM-SayCan system to integrate LLM with physical robotics.The Verge’s James Vincent pointed out real life is uncompromisingly messy.The New York Times got to see a live demo of the robot and reported it incorrectly identified soda flavors and misidentified fruit as the color white.Google’s new robot isn’t perfect.Humans instinctively know what to do: pick up the glass, get something to sop up the mess, throw that out, and be careful next time.Robots need more instruction just to do something simple for humans.But with the power of VLA models like RT-2, robots can access a larger set of information to infer what to do next.Previously, teaching a robot took a long time.

articles.paraphrased_content: Instead, we played through entire games with only the occasional (alleged) cheater rearing their head.The latest of those updates brought a chance for server player caps to be set to 100, far higher than the original 32.I was happily surprised not to play cat and mouse, running away from bots from one server to the next.(Image credit: Valve)Playing medic in the first few rounds meant that I spent most of my time trapped in spawn in a futile effort to give the heavy enough healing to make a dent in the enemy team's defense or at least kill one of the many turrets watching our exit doorrs.It can often be hard to freshen up a title like this, so even if 100-player servers may be hard to comprehend and even harder to find, it's at least a sign that this multiplayer FPS is still alive and kicking.While it's definitely true that it plays better than expected, as I was only phased into the backrooms once, it took a few games for the team matchmaking to balance out.If you're in the mood for a shooter that is slightly more current, then check out our best FPS games list for all the must-haves.Despite our experience in Team Fortress 2 being a mixed bag, it's great to see such a well-loved game getting some attention after all these years.Instead, many are still opting for the good old 32 players.Unfortunately, if you log onto the 16-year-old game, it doesn't seem as if anyone is playing in these gigantic areas.Valve are key to stress that while they're pushing the update, they didn't make it and it is "unsupported and not recommended".This was enough to remind me why I used to spend hours and hours playing Team Fortress 2 with my friends as I sped around the map as Scout and had the thrilling fights that I had long forgotten.Trapped in spawn with my back against the wall and a gaggle of pyros waiting at the exit, I can't help but think to myself that more players in Team Fortress 2 servers may not be a good thing.There's been a ton of great updates for Team Fortress 2 over the year ever since Valve announced its 'Big Summer Update'.The last time I ran around with a Scattergun was a few years ago when my group of friends had played through every multiplayer game known to man and had run out of ideas.After the initial joy wore off, we got to play a proper game of Team Fortress 2 for the first time in years, and it went exactly as you'd expect.At first, it was pleasantly fun, but soon we were plagued by hordes of bots, all pointing their sniper rifle to the sky and downing us with one shot as soon as we peeked out of spawn.While this new capacity sounds intriguing, you'll be hard-pressed to find a server which actually tests the limits of everything we know Team Fortress 2 is capable of.The update came complete with 14 new maps and 25 cosmetics; a veritable wedge of new and great content available to players.Thankfully this time around, there was nothing of the sort.Luckily, by the end, we managed to find a match with balanced matchmaking.Despite missing out on getting to see just how chaotic these 100-player servers are, the TRG team did have the perfect excuse to dive back into TF2 and what the state of this iconic title was like.Sadly, none of this worked out quite the way we wanted it to, as most of our games ended brutally.

articles.content:

articles.paraphrased_content:
And for Ford, the costs keep mounting.All of which is to say, there’s a long road ahead for Ford’s shift to electric vehicles.In addition to upgrading Ford’s existing factories, the company is also constructing several new facilities: a $3.5 billion battery facility in Marshall, Michigan; two additional battery factories in Kentucky; and a mega-campus vehicle assembly plant in Tennessee, which combined will cost $11.4 billion (a cost that Ford is sharing with SK Innovation).Ford lost $1.1 billion on its EV business this quarter

It’s been over a year since Ford split its business into two separate entities — one focused on electric vehicles called Ford Model e, and the other on gas-powered ones called Ford Blue.The company’s decision to jump aboard Tesla’s EV charging bandwagon and adopt the NACS (North American Charging Standard) for its future lineup may help assuage customers who were holding off on a purchase because of charging anxiety.And new products — the company currently only has two EVs, the Mustang Mach-E and F-150 Lightning — will attract new car buyers as well.It’s the sad truth of the auto industry.Ford’s electric future is being paid for by giant, gas-guzzling trucks and SUVs.That fact came into stark relief this week during the company’s second quarter earnings report, in which the Blue Oval reported losing $1.1 billion before interest and taxes on its EV business, more than twice as much it lost over the same period last year.He also noted that, for now and likely years to come, the profitable Ford Blue side of the business would be helping provide the cash to help pay for the Ford Model e side of the business.And demand is slowing, as new EVs sit on dealer lots unsold.But in the meantime, Ford will need to continue to sell big gas-guzzlers that pollute communities and contribute to our increasingly warming planet in order to generate enough revenue that it can then turn around and funnel into producing more zero-emission vehicles.Making electric vehicles is expensive.The company now expects to lose a total of $4.5 billion on its EV business for the entire year of 2023, up from a previous prediction of $3 billion in losses.Commercial vehicle sales also posted a healthy profit of $2.4 billion for the quarter.Making electric vehicles is expensive

Slower, yes, but Ford is also hurting its EV business with repeated price cuts as it continues to wage a price war with Tesla.Ford now expects to make 600,000 EVs by the end of 2024, a figure the company previously expected to hit by the end of this year.“While the shift to EVs is unquestionably underway, the last few weeks have shown us the adoption by early, majority customers will be a little slower than expected,” Ford’s chief financial officer, John Lawler, said on a call with investors.At the time, Ford CEO Jim Farley framed it as a necessary move that will help it better compete with companies like Tesla that have the luxury of focusing on only one type of vehicle technology.Also, production has been slower than expected, with temporary factory shutdowns for upgrades eating into the company’s ability to churn out enough EVs.Compare that to Ford’s profits in the sale of gas and hybrid trucks and SUVs: $2.3 billion before interest and taxes.

With Apple having reportedly secured 90 percent of TSMC’s N3 shipments, which is the first iteration of the firm’s 3nm technology, it makes complete sense for various companies like Qualcomm and MediaTek to skip N3 and place orders for N3E wafers instead.It is said that not only is N3 expensive to mass produce, but TSMC is also struggling with yields, which is not a combination that chipset manufacturers would enjoy hearing if they want to provide their own smartphone vendors with a steady supply of shipments in late 2024.

articles.author: Allison Johnson
articles.title: Samsung is working on dustproofing its foldables
articles.description: Samsung’s next Galaxy Z Fold and Z Flip might finally come with an IP68 rating, according to the company’s head of mobile business. Right now, they’re rated just IPX8, with no guarantees against dust intrusion.
articles.content:
Samsung is working on dustproofing its foldables
Samsung is working on dustproofing its foldables
 / You might actually be able to take your next folding phone to the beach.
ByAllison Johnson, a r… [+2155 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
Samsung’s phones aren’t totally hopeless against dust — the hinges include brushes to help keep dust out — but for whatever reason, the Flip and Fold haven’t come with an IP rating that reflects any level of dust resistance.Dust is the enemy of a folding phone, and Samsung says it’s working on measures to make its foldables much more dust-resistant.RelatedThe Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 gets a big little screen upgradeThe Galaxy Z Fold 5 is last year’s phone with a new hinge

It’s a hard problem for phones with moving parts, but it’s a hurdle that Samsung needs to clear if it wants to truly take foldables mainstream.Samsung mobile business president TM Roh talked about pursuing foldable dust resistance in a press conference following the company’s Unpacked event earlier this week, as reported by Korean outlet BizWatch and spotted by Android Authority.Roh said, “We are well aware of consumer demand for dustproofing, and we are making various efforts to achieve this.” He noted that Samsung added water resistance a few generations into its foldable line and asked Fold series fans to “please wait a little longer” for that dust resistance rating.Until then, our advice remains unchanged: please don’t bring your folding phone to the beach.OLED death is a terrible way for a phone to go.Slab-style flagships usually come with an IP68 rating, meaning they’re certified to be resistant to both dust and water to a certain degree; but Samsung’s foldables are only rated IPX8 — the 8 means you can fully submerge them in water, but the X is a big old “nope” for any kind of dust resistance.A dustproof folding phone is an exciting prospect and could represent a big step toward bringing foldables into the mainstream.The moving parts of a folding phone make it a tough problem to solve.The company’s current folding phones offer robust water resistance but currently don’t provide any protection against dust.Samsung’s competitors seem to be working on it, too: the Motorola Razr Plus comes with much lower water resistance, but its IP52 rating signifies limited protection against dust.
